workflow.name: Lead scoring & auto-assignment with GPT-4 and GoHighLevel + Slack alerts
workflow.description:
This workflow automatically scores and categorizes new GoHighLevel contacts using AI (GPT-4), then tags and assigns them to the appropriate team member based on their score. Hot leads also trigger a Slack notification for immediate follow-up.

### What does it do?
- Triggers when a new contact is added in GoHighLevel.
- Fetches full contact details and recent engagement data.
- Uses AI (GPT-4) to analyze and score the lead (1-100), categorize it (Hot, Warm, Cold), and provide an explanation.
- Tags the contact in GoHighLevel based on the score.
- Assigns the lead to the correct sales or nurturing team member.
- Sends a Slack alert for Hot leads to ensure fast response.

### Use case
Use this workflow to automate lead qualification and assignment in sales teams using GoHighLevel. It helps prioritize high-quality leads, ensures fast follow-up, and reduces manual work.

### How to configure
1. **GoHighLevel API:**  
   - Set your GoHighLevel API URL and API key in the `Workflow Configuration` node.
   - Update user IDs for assignment as needed.

2. **Slack Integration:**  
   - Add your Slack webhook URL or credentials in the `Slack Notify Hot Lead` node.

3. **AI Provider:**  
   - Configure your OpenAI (or compatible) credentials in the `AI Lead Scoring (GPT-4)` node.

4. **Adjust thresholds:**  
   - If needed, change the score thresholds in the IF nodes to match your business logic.

5. **Activate the workflow:**  
   - Once configured, activate the workflow to start processing new leads automatically.

---

**Tip:**  
You can further customize the workflow to fit your sales process, add more notifications, or integrate with other tools as needed.

workflow.name: AI Lead Scoring and Auto-Assignment for GoHighLevel Contacts

assignments.name: topRepUserId
assignments.value: <__PLACEHOLDER_VALUE__Top Sales Rep User ID for Hot Leads__>

assignments.value: <__PLACEHOLDER_VALUE__Secondary Sales Rep User ID for Warm Leads__>

assignments.value: <__PLACEHOLDER_VALUE__Nurture Team User ID for Cold Leads__>

assignments.name: slackChannel
assignments.value: <__PLACEHOLDER_VALUE__Slack Channel ID for Hot Lead Notifications (e.g., #sales)__>

assignments.name: contactId
assignments.value: ={{ $('GHL Get Contact Details').first().json.contact?.id || $('GHL Get Contact Details').first().json.id || '' }}

options.instructions:
You are an expert sales lead scoring assistant. Your task is to analyze lead data and score leads from 1 to 100 based on:

1. Buying Intent: Signals that indicate readiness to purchase
2. Engagement Level: Email opens, clicks, website visits, form submissions
3. Behavior Signals: Frequency and recency of interactions
4. Lead Quality: Completeness of contact information, lead source quality
5. Urgency: Time-sensitive indicators

Provide your response in the following JSON format:
{
  "score": <number between 1-100>,
  "category": "<Hot|Warm|Cold>",
  "reasoning": "<brief explanation of the score>",
  "confidence": "<high|medium|low>"
}

Scoring Guidelines:
- Hot Lead (80-100): High engagement, strong buying signals, quality source
- Warm Lead (40-79): Moderate engagement, some interest signals
- Cold Lead (1-39): Low engagement, minimal signals, needs nurturing

nodes.name: GHL Assign Hot to Top Rep
GHL Assign Warm to Secondary Rep
GHL Assign Cold to Nurture Team

parameters.content:
## How it works
This workflow scores every new GoHighLevel contact with AI and routes them to the right sales owner.

A webhook trigger fires when a new contact is created in GHL. The workflow fetches full contact and engagement data, cleans it and prepares a compact JSON payload for AI.

An AI node analyzes demographics, source and engagement, then returns a numeric score (1‚Äì100), segment (Hot/Warm/Cold) and short reasoning. That score is parsed and used in two IF checks: ‚â•80 = Hot, ‚â•40 = Warm, otherwise Cold.

Depending on the segment, the contact is tagged in GHL and automatically assigned to the top rep, secondary rep, or nurture team. Hot leads also generate a Slack notification so the team can follow up immediately. The workflow ends by sending a simple webhook response back to GHL.

## Setup steps
1. Create a GHL webhook trigger and point it to this workflow URL.
2. Add your GHL API key, base URL and user IDs in **Workflow Configuration**.
3. Connect Slack and choose the channel for Hot lead alerts.
4. Adjust the AI prompt and score thresholds if needed (80/40 by default).
5. Send a test contact from GHL, verify tags/owners/Slack, then enable the webhook.

## Trigger & Config

Receives new contacts from GoHighLevel via webhook and loads core config: API key, base URL, owner IDs, and Slack channel.

## Contact & Engagement Data

Pulls full contact details and engagement history from GHL, then cleans and structures the data into a compact JSON payload for AI scoring.

## AI Lead Scoring

Uses AI to score the lead (1‚Äì100) and return segment + reasoning. The parser converts the AI output into numeric fields used for routing.

## Route & Assign

Routes leads based on score: Hot, Warm, or Cold. Tags the contact, assigns the right owner in GHL, and sends a Slack alert for Hot leads.

main.node: GHL Assign Hot to Top Rep
GHL Assign Cold to Nurture Team
GHL Assign Warm to Secondary Rep

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
